text: William Victor Roth Jr. (July 22, 1921 â€“ December 13, 2003) was an American lawyer and politician. He was a member of the Republican Party. From 1967 to 1970, he was the U.S. Representative from Delaware and from 1971 to 2001, he was a U.S. Senator. Roth was a sponsor of legislation creating the Roth IRA, an individual retirement plan that can be set up with a broker. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2003 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:United States representatives from Delaware Category:United States senators from Delaware Category:Lawyers from Montana Category:Politicians from Montana Category:Businesspeople from Montana Category:Businesspeople from Wilmington, Delaware Category:People from Great Falls, Montana Category:Politicians from Wilmington, Delaware Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Lawyers from Delaware
title: William Roth
